Module AppointmentScheduleAPP
Package Controller

Class AppointmentController

java.lang.Object
Controller.AppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
NewAppointmentController
public class AppointmentController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The Appointment controller class builds and populates the Appointment> tableview. Navigation buttons are included in the header for easy navigation between scenes. There are buttons for modifying existing appointments, creating new appointments, and deleting appointments. The table is initialized with all appointments available in the SQL database. Radio buttons offer filtering by week or month for the user. The methods that define the filtering are located in the AppointmentDAO Java class.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the Appointment tableview with all appointments in the database. A ChangeListener is used to monitor when the user switches between the radio buttons in the toggle group. The selection of the radio buttons determine which method in the AppointmentDAO Java class to call for filtering the appointment data: getCurrentWeekAppts() or getCurrentMonthAppts() or getAllAppointments().

      Lambda Expression Usage This lambda expression uses the ChangeListener functional interface and defines the changed method to monitor when the user selects between the three radio buttons.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • setApptListTableView

      public void setApptListTableView(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> appointment)
      This method sets the data to the tableview based on the ObservableList that is passed into the parameter. This method is called when a radio button is selected and a method from AppointmentDAO creates the ObservableList that is passed.
      Parameters:
      appointment - An ObservableList from AppointmentDAO which is generated when the user selects a radio button.

    • toUpdateAppt

      public void toUpdateAppt(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Passes the selected appointment from the tableview to the UpdateAppt class. After checking the user selected a row in the table, the SceneMovements.goToPage method is used to open the Update Appointment scene.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Selecting the #toUpdateAppt button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • toNewAppt

      public void toNewAppt(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Opens the NewAppointment scene using SceneMovements.goToPage method.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Selecting the #toNewAppt button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • deleteAppt

      public void deleteAppt(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Verifies an appointment is selected, if one is not, an alert shows. Gets the selected appointment and shows an alert confirming that the user wants to delete the specified appointment. Shows an alert notifying the user that the selection was deleted. Refreshes the Appointment tableview.

      Lambda Expression Disclosure: This lambda expression is used to define the response method when the user selects the confirmation button. Instead of creating a separate method that is only needed a few times and calling it in this method, a lambda expression is used for cleaner coding and easier reading.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Pressing the #deleteAppt button

    • onActionToCustomer

      public void onActionToCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Calls the SceneMovements.goToPage method to change to the CustomerList fxml.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The #onActionToCustomer button
      Throws:
      IOException
